title: Mauricio Pochettino takes a break from Tottenham's crisis with a trip to Qatar
text:
Mauricio Pochettino has escaped the crisis engulfing Tottenham by flying to Qatar for a two-day break - as a guest of Paris Saint-Germain's owners.

The Argentine, who has overseen a disastrous start to the season, departed for the Middle East after Saturday's 3-0 defeat at the hands of Brighton.

Pochettino's trip, which comes at the start of the international break, is to attend the Aspire Global Summit on football performance.

Mauricio Pochettino gives a speech at the Aspire Global Summit on football performance

He gave a speech at the event on Monday, telling a star-studded audience that 'football is not an ordinary business'.

The event has been in Pochettino's diary for some time and Tottenham have no problem with him attending, despite their problems on the pitch.

Saturday's defeat at the Amex followed a humiliating 7-2 thrashing by Bayern Munich in the Champions League and a Carabao Cup defeat by League One Colchester.

During his speech, Pochettino added: 'We at Tottenham work as a team. After two big defeats like the ones we have suffered, we have to think about the future.

Tottenham boss Pochettino is enjoying a two day visit to Qatar during the international break

'You have to recover the emotional level. When you are on the top, you feel you must respond to dignity.

'It is difficult to control the emotions when you play the Champions League final and in a few months you are now in the situation you are in.

'Things change fast in football. You can be a team last year and a very different one now. In our hand is changing the dynamics. Fight. This sport works like this.

Tottenham's players appear dejected during Saturday's 3-0 defeat away at Brighton

'The team has lost confidence after two goals against. We have to work to win that trust again. We talk to the players. We tell them that we have lost by mistakes, but we must try to forget them.

'The best way to help the player is not telling him that he has done s***. You can't hide. You have to share the responsibility.'

Manchester United, who have previously held an interest in Pochettino, were among the clubs to send a delegation to the summit.

The Red Devils have endured a similarly difficult start to the campaign under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer and currently find themselves just two points off the relegation zone after Sunday's 1-0 defeat at Brighton.

Pochettino and his staff have overseen a poor start to the season and sit ninth in the table

PSG, where the former Southampton boss spent two years as a player, were also represented at the event along with Italian giants Juventus.

Pochettino, who has been accompanied on the trip by his assistant Jesus Perez, is due back at Tottenham on Thursday.

First-team coaches Toni Jimenez and Miguel D'Agostino are in charge of training in his absence, although most of the Spurs squad are away on international duty.
description: Mauricio Pochettino has escaped the crisis engulfing Tottenham by flying to Qatar for a two-day break - as a guest of Paris Saint-Germain's owners.
